node.title: White nationalists ordered to pay millions to victims of Charlottesville protests
node.alt: A group of protesters hold a white anti-racism sign with an 19th century statue behind on sunny day
node.description: Nine victims of violence during the deadly Unite the Right demonstrations in the US in 2017 have invoked a 150-year-old law designed to protect freed slaves to claim over $US25 million in damages.
node.content:
["A US jury has ordered white nationalist leaders and organisations to pay more than $US25 million ($35.5 million) in damages over violence that erupted during the deadly 2017 Unite the Right rally in Charlottesville.", "After a nearly month-long civil trial, the US\u00a0District Court jury was deadlocked on two key claims but found the white nationalists liable on four other counts in the lawsuit.", "It was filed by nine people who suffered physical or emotional injuries during the two days of demonstrations.", "Lawyer Roberta Kaplan said the plaintiffs' legal team planned to refile the suit so a new jury could\u00a0decide the two claims this jury was\u00a0unable to reach a verdict on.", "She described the amount\u00a0of damages awarded from the other counts as\u00a0\"eye opening\".", "", "
Ku Klux Klan members face counter-protesters at Charlottesville in 2017.(Reuters: Jonathan Ernst)
", "White nationalist leader Richard Spencer vowed to appeal against the decision, saying the \"entire theory of that verdict is fundamentally flawed\".", "He said the plaintiffs' lawyers made it clear before the trial they wanted to use the case to bankrupt him and other defendants.", "\"I'm doing fine right now because I had kind of accepted in my heart the worst that could happen. I had hope, of course, but I'm not terribly surprised or crestfallen.\"", "", "
One person was killed and dozens were injured when a car ploughed into a large group of protesters in\u00a0Charlottesville\u00a0.(AP: Steve Helber)
", "Lawyers for the plaintiffs invoked a 150-year-old law passed after the Civil War to shield freed slaves from violence and protect their civil rights.", "Commonly known as the Ku Klux Klan act, the law contains a rarely used provision that allows private citizens to sue other citizens for civil rights violations.", "Hundreds of white nationalists descended on Charlottesville for the Unite the Right rally on August 11 and August 12, 2017, ostensibly to protest city plans to remove a statue of General Robert E\u00a0Lee, who led soldiers from pro-slavery states in the US Civil War.", "During a march on the University of Virginia campus, white nationalists chanted \"Jews will not replace us,\"\u00a0and surrounded counter-protesters and threw tiki torches at them.", "", "
James Alex Fields Jr was jailed for life in 2019 for numerous federal hate crimes.(Supplied: Albermale County Jail)
", "The following day, an avowed admirer of Adolf Hitler rammed his car into a crowd of counter-protesters, killing one woman and injuring dozens more.", "Then-US president Donald Trump touched off a political firestorm when he failed to immediately denounce the white nationalists, saying there were \"very fine people on both sides\".", "The driver of the car, James Alex Fields Jr, is serving life in prison for murder and hate crimes.", "AP/ABC"]
